statement.p: Explain why the vectors \left[\begin{array}{r} -2 \\ -1 \\ -1 \\ 3 \\ -3 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -2 \\ 4 \\ -4 \\ -1 \\ 3 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 4 \\ -8 \\ 8 \\ 2 \\ -6 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 1 \\ -2 \\ -3 \\ 0 \\ -4 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{r} -5 \\ 5 \\ 8 \\ 3 \\ 9 \end{array}\right] are or are not a basis of \mathbb{R}^5

answer.p: The vectors \left[\begin{array}{r} -2 \\ -1 \\ -1 \\ 3 \\ -3 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -2 \\ 4 \\ -4 \\ -1 \\ 3 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 4 \\ -8 \\ 8 \\ 2 \\ -6 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 1 \\ -2 \\ -3 \\ 0 \\ -4 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{r} -5 \\ 5 \\ 8 \\ 3 \\ 9 \end{array}\right] are not a basis of \mathbb{R}^5.
